actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that any fully insured individual may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze if he has 40 quarters of coverage, regardless of when such quarters were earned, even if he does not have 20 quarters of coverage during the 40-quarter period immediately preceding his disability.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Provides that any individual fully insured under title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze if he has 40 quarters of coverage, regardless of when such quarters were earned.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that any fully insured individual may qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze if he has 40 quarters of coverage, regardless of when such quarters were earned, even if he does not have 20 quarters of coverage during the 40-quarter period immediately preceding his disability.
